title: Enhanced the frontend by following minimalistic design principles of information page
body:
## Description

This update adds an information page highlighting the importance of a to-do list for users. It aims to help users understand how a to-do list can enhance organization, increase productivity, and reduce stress.

## Type of change

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] This change requires a documentation update

## How Has This Been Tested?

The content has been reviewed for clarity and relevance. No functional testing is required as this is a static information page.

- [x] Reviewed content for accuracy and readability

title: Removed Bouncing Animation for to-do title
body:
I have removed the animation styling in style.css, so the "To-Do's" bouncing animation has been stopped.

## Description

This commit removes the bouncing animation from the .subtitle class in the CSS file. The animation was found to be unnecessary for the overall user experience and has been eliminated to provide a cleaner and more consistent interface. This change enhances the readability of the subtitle without the distraction of animation effects.

title: [FEATURE] Add recurring tasks to your to-do list app
body:
Hello! I would like to contribute in this project .
There is a need to add recurring tasks dropdown to enhance the to-do list

**The above feature has following benefits:**
1)I**ncreased Productivity:**
-It automates the process of re-adding regular tasks, helping users manage routine responsibilities without manually entering them each time.
2)**Enhanced User Experience:**
-Users can focus on new tasks and goals without worrying about missing out on regular commitments like paying bills, attending meetings, or exercising.

**Automating recurring tasks frees up time for users to focus on more critical tasks, thus enhancing overall efficiency.
I would share you the updates through screenshots**

title: [FEATURE] A clean landing page for the website, which may house login, feed or Upcoming tasks
body:
**Problem**
There is no landing page for the website, and the link just leads to the to-do list itself but does not have any specific avenues that might allow the users to introduce themselves to the website, so that the website might remember them in the future. Nor does it have any facility for users to migrate their tasks between devices.

**Solution**
A landing page which houses login portal and might house more features down the line such as profile or upcoming tasks, or even a friend list, which might allow multiple users to share their tasks and also collaborate on multiple tasks.

comments.body: If it would be possible, I would like to work on this, I would also be highly obliged if the 'hacktoberfest-accepted' tag can be added to this if the issue gets accepted. Thank you

Thanks for contributing, kindly give ⭐ star to the repository before starting the work.
@Anshgrover23  I have raised a pull request for this issue which has passed all the checks. I also made an error page for this website to help with development down the line.

title: [FEATURE] ANIMATIONS AND CSS enhancements
body:
# Enhance Homepage with CSS Animations and Effects

## Overview
I've been exploring the homepage of this project, and while it's functional, I believe we can elevate its visual appeal and user engagement through some creative enhancements using CSS and animations.

## Suggestions
Here are a few ideas I have in mind:

1. **Add CSS Animations:**
   - Implement subtle animations for elements on the page (e.g., buttons, images, and headings) to create a more dynamic experience.

2. **Enhance Button Styles:**
   - Style buttons with transitions and hover effects to make them stand out and encourage user interaction.

3. **Typography Improvements:**
   - Using varying font sizes, weights, and colors to create a visual hierarchy and draw attention to key information.

4. **Mobile Responsiveness:**
   - Ensuring that any enhancements are responsive and maintain their effectiveness on mobile devices.

## Benefits
- Improved user engagement and retention.
- A more modern and polished look that aligns with current design trends.
- Potentially increased user interaction with call-to-action elements.

## Next Steps
I have some awesome ideas already in my mind as i have made many such projects. Please assign this issue to me and let's make this project more engaging.

Looking forward to your thoughts!

Best,  
[Dhruv Davda]
author: Dhruv-Davda

comments.body: @Anshgrover23 Please assign this issue to me. Am ready with some aesthetic css and animations. Thanks !

title: Error handing
body:
## Description

Added comprehensive error handling and toast messages for all major routes, including file uploads, database connections, profile and account endpoints, and feedback submission. 

Profile and Account Endpoints: Added validation for required fields and error handling for data updates and retrieval.
Database Connection: Application exits gracefully if unable to connect to MongoDB.
File Uploads: Ensured that all fields and attachments are properly validated.
Feedback Submission: Ensured both emoji and feedback are required.

Fixes #(issue number)

## Type of change

Please delete options that are not relevant.

- [X] Bug fix (non-breaking change)

## How Has This Been Tested?

Please describe the tests that you ran to verify your changes. Provide instructions so that they can be reproduced.

Tests were conducted to verify the functionality of the todo list with the added error handling. The following tests were performed:

 - [X] Test A: Add a new task with valid inputs to confirm correct creation and storage.
 - [X] Test B: Attempt to add a task with incomplete inputs to ensure validation messages are displayed.
 - [X] Test C: Edit a task and verify that the updates are reflected correctly in the UI and local storage.
 - [X] Test D: Delete a task and check that it is removed from both the UI and local storage.
 - [X] Test E: Simulate a localStorage failure to ensure graceful handling of errors.

## Checklist:

- [X] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [X] I have performed a self-review of my code
- [X] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [X] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [X] My changes generate no new warnings
- [X] Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules
author: Ananya54321

title: Update script.js with better error handling
body:
## Description

This update focuses on adding error handling throughout the todo list application to enhance its robustness and user experience. Critical operations such as adding, editing, deleting tasks, local storage interactions, and updating the displayed todo list are now enclosed in try...catch blocks. This ensures the application gracefully handles errors and provides clear feedback to the user.

Additionally, validation checks are included to prevent the creation of tasks without all required fields. The goal is to improve reliability and prevent potential crashes during user interactions.



## Type of change

Please delete options that are not relevant.

- [ X] Bug fix (non-breaking change)

## How Has This Been Tested?

- [ X]  Test E: Simulate a localStorage failure to ensure graceful handling of errors.

title: Enhance Todo List: Add 'Enter' Key Functionality for Task Addition and Editing
body:
This PR enhances the functionality of the Todo List application by adding support for triggering both task addition and task updates via the "Enter" key, improving the overall user experience. Previously, users had to manually click the "Add" or "Update" buttons to add or edit tasks. Now, pressing the "Enter" key while entering a task or editing an existing task will perform the corresponding action automatically. 

#### **Changes Made:**
- **Enter Key Functionality:**
  - Implemented key event listeners for the "Enter" key across the task input fields.
  - Users can now press "Enter" to:
    - Add a new task when not in edit mode.
    - Update an existing task when in edit mode.
  
- **Task Editing Workflow:**
  - Added a flag (`isEditing`) to track whether the user is in "add" or "edit" mode.
  - Stored the index of the task being edited (`editingIndex`) to ensure the correct task is updated.
  - Automatically switch between "Add" and "Update" buttons based on the current mode (task addition or editing).

- **UX Enhancement:**
  - The input fields are now more responsive, and task management is smoother.
  - Minor tweaks to the layout and styling were made for better consistency.

#### **Issue Link:**
Closes #18  – Add "Enter Key" Functionality to Trigger Task Submission

#### **Additional Notes:**
Please add the **Hacktoberfest** label to this PR as part of the Hacktoberfest initiative, so it can be counted towards contributions for participants.

title: Add default date and time autofill feature
body:
## What does this PR do?
This PR introduces the following changes:

Adds a feature that automatically sets the local date and time in the input fields by default when adding new todos.
The default date and time fields are auto-filled with the current date and time when the form is opened or when a todo is added.

Fixes #14 
## Feature Overview:
- Date Input: Automatically shows the current date in YYYY-MM-DD format.
- Time Input: Automatically shows the current time in HH:MM format.
- This functionality updates when a new todo is added.


## Implementation Details:
- JavaScript function setDefault() implemented to fetch the local date and time.
- The function updates the respective input fields (.js-date-input and .js-time-input).
- Set an interval to keep the default time in sync with the local system time, refreshing every minute.
- The Interval is cleared when the user changes the date input element, to ensure stability and not making redundant load
- The Interval is again set when a todo is added by user

## Additional Considerations:
- The feature ensures that the date and time are updated correctly even if the user doesn't manually select them.
- The interval management is included for ensuring accurate time.

## How to Test:
- Open the app.
- Verify that the date and time fields are automatically populated with the current local date and time when adding new todos.
- Ensure that the time updates in real-time if the form is left open.
- Change the date input element, and check for some time the date and time shouldn't be modified in this case
- Upon adding a todo, the interval shall start working as it was.
